official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to recognize
		  tinnitus as a mandatory condition for research and treatment by the Department
		  of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Tinnitus Research and Treatment Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall recognize tinnitus as a mandatory condition for research
			 and treatment by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Department of Veterans Affairs Auditory Centers of
			 Excellence

header.#text:
Recognition and
			 treatment of tinnitus at Department of Veterans Affairs Auditory Centers of
			 Excellence

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 ensure that research is conducted at

facilities
			 on the prevention and treatment of tinnitus. Such research shall
			 include—

header.#text:
Research on
			 prevention and treatment of tinnitus

text.#text:
studies on the underlying etiology of
			 tinnitus in veteran populations that occur as a result of different causal
			 factors, including blast-related tinnitus where there is no measurable hearing
			 loss versus other forms of noise-induced tinnitus where there is hearing loss;
			 and

a study of the underlying mechanisms
			 between hearing loss and tinnitus, including cases in which one or the other
			 condition is present, but not both.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall ensure the cooperation of the
with the Hearing Center of Excellence established by the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1443 IH: Tinnitus Research and Treatment Act of 2013
